alert.note: Alert for Dale; Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 5:41AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Dale and northern Henry Counties through 615 AM CDT... At 540 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Blue Springs State Park, or 8 miles west of Abbeville, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Shorterville, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Edwin, Otho, Scottsboro Crossroads, Double Bridges, Barefield Crossroads, Murphy Station, Graball, Screamer, Coates, Clopton, Thomas Mill Creek, Bertha, Lawrenceville, Abbeville Municipal A/P and Willis Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for southeastern Alabama.
